Class DoilyPanel

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • DoilyPanel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class DoilyPanel
extends javax.swing.JPanel
    JPanel that provides the main drawing area and an interface to change properties like pen size etc.
    Author:
    dmh2g16
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Erases the current drawing (but not history). The old drawing is added to the history stack

        public void saveState()
        Saves the current state of the image by pushing all the points onto the stack

      • undo

        public void undo()
        Undoes a previous action by popping off the stack and replacing the current points array with it. Disables undo button if now empty

      • paintComponent

        protected void paintComponent(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Main drawing function. Draws sector lines if option enabled and a point under the mouse cursor (for preview). Then draws all the points in the array, connecting lines if necessary to produce smooth lines
        Overrides:
        paintComponent in class javax.swing.JComponent

      • paintSectorLines

        public void paintSectorLines(java.awt.Graphics2D g2d)
        Paints the sector lines denoting the edge of sectors
        Parameters:
        g2d - Graphics object to do drawing
